messages.content:
You are a world state generator for a workplace benchmark. Your job is to transform an abstract scenario into a concrete, detailed world_state JSON.

The world_state should include:
1. All metadata from the scenario (scenario_id, description, noise_level, depth, global_settings, people, projects)
2. sub_scenarios_expanded: For each abstract sub_scenario from the input scenario, create a concrete expanded version with:
   - Concrete ISO datetime timestamps
   - Specific participant IDs/emails
   - Detailed event descriptions
   - Any seeds needed for data generation
   - This array should contain ONLY the expanded versions of the sub_scenarios listed in the input scenario
3. noise_scenarios: An array of noise-only scenario objects that are NOT part of the core sub_scenarios:
   - These should be realistic but unrelated workplace events/messages/activities
   - Each noise scenario should have similar structure to sub_scenarios_expanded (id, type, timestamps, participants, etc.)
   - The number of noise scenarios should scale with the noise_level parameter

IMPORTANT: Do NOT include per_source_plans in the world_state. The world_state is scenario-centric only.

IMPORTANT PARAMETERS:
- noise_level (0-1): Controls amount of unrelated/off-task data
  * 0 = almost no noise, only data directly relevant to sub_scenarios (noise_scenarios should be empty or minimal)
  * 1 = lots of unrelated messages/events/files (still realistic) (noise_scenarios should contain many entries)
- depth (0-1): Controls how indirect the evidence is
  * 0 = sub_scenario realized directly (e.g., one clear Slack message)
  * 1 = sub_scenario requires multi-step, multi-source chaining to infer
  * Intermediate values interpolate behavior

CRITICAL: sub_scenarios_expanded must correspond exactly to the sub_scenarios in the input scenario. All other unrelated scenarios should go in noise_scenarios.

You must output ONLY valid JSON matching the world_state schema. Do not include markdown code fences.

raw_message.content:

            "body": "Internal ETA update: implementation nearly done, pending final QA and experiment configuration.\n\nRough timeline:\n- Code complete: by Thu 20 Nov\n- QA + bugfix: 2â€“3 days\n- Gradual rollout start: target 26â€“27 Nov (assuming no major blockers)\n\nThis is not a public commitment yet, but Support/Sales can communicate \"end of November\" as a safe window.",

          }
        },

We're currently in the final implementation and QA stages. Barring any unexpected issues, we expect the new login experience to be available by the end of November.\n\nIf anything changes materially, your account manager will keep you posted.\n\nBest regards,\nSam\nSenior Support Engineer",

        {
          "channel": "email",
          "message_id": "email_weekly_report_draft",
          "timestamp": "2025-11-21T14:02:00+00:00",
          "actor": "person_alex_smith",
          "participants": [
            "person_alex_smith"
          ],
          "data": {
            "action": "draft",
            "from": "alex.smith@company.com",
            "to": [
              "web-redesign-stakeholders@company.com"
            ],
            "cc": [],
            "subject": "[WEB] Weekly update - Week of 17 Nov",
            "body": "Draft notes:\n- Performance: homepage load times improved by ~15% vs last week (bundle and image optimizations).\n- Growth: weekly active users up ~10% WoW, mix of campaigns + better UX.\n- Planning: rescheduled cross-team planning with Sales/Support to align on rollout.",
            "thread_id": "email_thread_weekly_report_web_w47",
            "project_key": "WEB"
          }
        },
        {
          "channel": "email",
          "message_id": "email_weekly_report_send",
          "timestamp": "2025-11-21T14:18:00+00:00",
          "actor": "person_alex_smith",
          "participants": [
            "person_alex_smith",
            "person_taylor_brown",
            "person_casey_jones",
            "person_jordan_johnson",
            "person_sam_williams"
          ],
          "data": {
            "action": "send",
            "from": "alex.smith@company.com",
            "to": [
              "web-redesign-stakeholders@company.com"
            ],
            "cc": [
              "eng-leads@company.com"
            ],
            "subject": "[WEB] Weekly update - Week of 17 Nov",
            "body": "Hi all,\n\nSharing this week's highlights for the Website Redesign project:\n\n1) Performance\n- We shipped several bundle and image optimizations.\n- Result: median homepage load time improved by roughly 15% compared to last week, which should help both SEO and conversion.\n\n2) User growth\n- Weekly active users on the marketing site are up around 10% week over week.\n- This is partly driven by ongoing campaigns, but early signals suggest the smoother experience is contributing as well.\n\n3) Rollout & planning\n- Implementation of the new login experience (WEB-101) is nearing completion; we're targeting a phased rollout toward the end of the month.\n- We rescheduled the cross-team planning session with Sales and Support to ensure everyone is aligned on rollout expectations and support readiness.\n\nAs always, reply here or ping me on Slack if you have questions.\n\nThanks,\nAlex",
            "thread_id": "email_thread_weekly_report_web_w47",
            "project_key": "WEB"
          }
        },
        {
          "channel": "slack",
          "message_id": "slack_weekly_report_link",
          "timestamp": "2025-11-21T14:26:00+00:00",
          "actor": "person_alex_smith",
          "participants": [
            "person_alex_smith",
            "person_taylor_brown",
            "person_casey_jones",
            "person_jordan_johnson",
            "person_sam_williams"
          ],
          "data": {
            "team": "engineering",
            "channel_name": "eng-web-redesign",
            "action": "message",
            "text": "Sent out this week's WEB update via email (subject: \"[WEB] Weekly update - Week of 17 Nov\"). TL;DR: ~15% perf improvement and ~10% WoW growth in weekly actives. Nice work everyone.",
            "thread_root_id": "slack_weekly_report_link",
            "project_reference": "WEB"
          }
        }
      ]
    }
